parts.text: {"word":"sheathe","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"(刀剣などを)鞘に納める","english_definition":"to put a sword, knife, etc. into its sheath.","examples":[{"sentence":"He sheathed his sword after the battle.","translation":"彼は戦いの後、剣を鞘に納めた。"},{"sentence":"She quickly sheathed the dagger.","translation":"彼女は素早く短剣を鞘に納めた。"}],"collocations":["sheathe a sword","sheathe a knife","sheathe a weapon"],"synonyms":["encase","holster"],"antonyms":["unsheathe","draw"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"(…で)覆う、包む","english_definition":"to cover something with a protective layer.","examples":[{"sentence":"The ship's hull was sheathed in copper.","translation":"船の船体は銅で覆われていた。"},{"sentence":"The wires were sheathed in plastic.","translation":"電線はプラスチックで覆われていた。"}],"collocations":["sheathe in metal","sheathe in plastic","sheathe in wood"],"synonyms":["cover","encase","clad","overlay","wrap"],"antonyms":["uncover","expose"]}],"etymology":{"value":"Old English *scēathian* 'to put into a sheath', from *scēathe* 'sheath'. Related to Dutch *schede* and German *Scheide* 'sheath'.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ʃiːð/","syllables":"sheathe"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["sheathe","sheathes"],"past_simple":"sheathed","past_participle":"sheathed","present_participle":"sheathing"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Sheathe' is primarily used in two contexts: placing a bladed weapon into its protective case (the sheath), and covering something with a protective layer. The first usage is more literal, while the second is often figurative, implying protection or preservation.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"He sheethed his sword.","correct":"He sheathed his sword.","note":"'Sheathe' is the correct verb, not 'sheethe'."},{"incorrect":"The tree was sheathed by snow.","correct":"The tree was sheathed in snow.","note":"Use 'sheathed in' to indicate the material used for covering."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["sheath (noun)"],"phrasal_verbs":[]},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"C1","frequency_google_ngram":"Low frequency","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C1","text":"'Sheathe' is a relatively uncommon word. It is most often used in historical or literary contexts when describing the act of putting a sword or knife back into its protective case. It can also be used more generally to describe covering something for protection, but this usage is less frequent."},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The knight sheathed his sword, signaling the end of the duel.","translation":"騎士は決闘の終わりを告げるために剣を鞘に納めた。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"鞘に納める"},{"sentence":"The cables were sheathed in a thick layer of rubber.","translation":"ケーブルは厚いゴムの層で覆われていた。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"覆う"}]}
